intro: Psychotria cordifolia, commonly known as the "heart-leaved psychotria," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers that are often white or pale green. It contains various alkaloids, some of which have been studied for their potential pharmacological properties. Due to its ecological role and chemical composition, it is of interest in both botanical research and traditional medicine.
